complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement Multi-Tier Subscription System with Stripe
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the Stripe integration into discrete subtasks: API initialization, product/price creation, tier logic implementation for each subscription level, webhook setup, usage-based pricing, dashboard UI/UX, affiliate tracking, error handling, security, and compliance. Include subtasks for unit/integration testing, documentation, and deployment.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task involves complex integration with a third-party payment provider, multiple subscription tiers, usage-based pricing, webhooks, and affiliate tracking. Each area requires careful handling of security, compliance, and edge cases. Industry best practices recommend modularizing payment logic, isolating webhook processing, and ensuring robust test coverage. The breadth of features and the need for reliability and scalability justify a high complexity score and a detailed subtask breakdown.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into subtasks for UI/UX design, workflow data modeling, n8n API integration, export/import logic, cloning feature, execution history tracking, metrics dashboard, example workflow creation, authentication/authorization, and comprehensive testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task requires integrating with n8n APIs, building a user-facing gallery, supporting workflow cloning, and tracking execution metrics. The need for real-time updates, robust data handling, and a polished UI increases complexity. Best practices suggest separating API integration, UI, and metrics logic, and providing thorough testing for import/export and cloning features.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Decompose into subtasks for Stripe data integration, revenue dashboard, churn analysis algorithms, feature usage tracking, ROI calculator, data visualization, real-time updates, export functionality, access control, backend API development, frontend implementation, and end-to-end testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Business intelligence dashboards require secure data integration, complex analytics (churn, ROI), real-time updates, and export features. Each metric and visualization should be modularized. Industry standards recommend separating data ingestion, analytics, and presentation layers, with strong focus on data accuracy and security.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into subtasks for Supabase integration, progress tracking logic, certificate generation, course completion, AI learning path algorithm, code playground, project submission, peer review, user authentication, role management, UI/UX for each feature, backend APIs, testing, documentation, and deployment.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Core LMS features span multiple domains: database integration, AI, interactive coding, and peer workflows. Each feature is substantial and requires its own backend, frontend, and testing. Best practices call for modular, testable components and clear separation of concerns, especially for AI and real-time features.
